title: Ensure consistency of compile time and runtime trigonometric functions
body:
For the following code:
```fortran
program test_sin
implicit none
real, parameter :: x = sin(1.0)
real :: y, z, one

one = 1.0
y = sin(1.0)
z = sin(one)
print *, x, y, z
end
```
LFortran currently gives:
```console
$ lfortran a.f90
8.41470957e-01 8.41470957e-01 8.41471016e-01
```
The first two use a compile time `sin(x)` which currently uses [std::sin](https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/numeric/math/sin) in C++, which uses whatever the C++ compiler uses, some kind of `libm` implementation. The last one is a runtime `libm` that was used to compile the runtime library, which should be the same implementation in my case, but somehow isn't. 

We should ensure that we *can* return exactly the same answer for both compile time and runtime, either by default or with a compiler option.
